intro: Psychotria aganosmifolia, commonly known as the "scented psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically greenish-white with prominent yellow stamens, and it produces small, dark blue to black berries. Psychotria aganosmifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
